cards.back:
L{f(t-T)u(t-T)} = e^(-sT)F(s)

Delay by T = multiply by e^(-sT)

L{e^(at)f(t)} = F(s-a)

Multiply by exponential = shift in s

L{df/dt} = sF(s) - f(0-)

Differentiate in t = multiply by s (minus IC)

L{d²f/dt²} = s²F(s) - sf(0-) - f'(0-)

Two derivatives = s² (with both ICs)

L{∫f dt} = F(s)/s

Integrate in t = divide by s

L{f*g} = F(s)·G(s)

Convolution in time = multiplication in s

f(0+) = lim(s→∞) sF(s)

Find initial value from F(s)

f(∞) = lim(s→0) sF(s)

Find steady-state (if stable)

L{t·f(t)} = -dF(s)/ds

Multiply by t = negative s-differentiate

cards.front: When does final value theorem fail?
cards.back: When poles of sF(s) are in RHP or repeated on jω-axis. System must be stable for finite final value.
